intro: Orobus pisiformis, commonly known as the kidney bean vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces elongated pods that contain kidney-shaped seeds, which are edible when properly prepared. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of legumes. Orobus pisiformis is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, benefiting surrounding plants.
